page.title: 08BADGERS IN ST.WENN AREA
page.content:
In{Blackhay woods}we found a{badgers sett in some brambles and we started to break them down. We managed to get in by the sett. It smelled funny.
I started to count the{exits.}I managed to count{eighteen.}We did not see or hear any{badgers}but there was a big hole in a hedge about six foot above the ground some distance away. There was also a toilet there.It was a hole dug in the ground. Near the exits there was straw and hay where the badgers had changed their bedding.It was interesting to see all this.
We also saw some scratching on the trees. It was not near the{badgers {sett.}They do that to mark out their territory.
